name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
review: A timeless classic that explores themes of racial injustice, morality, and compassion in the American South.

author: George Orwell
review: A dystopian masterpiece that warns against totalitarianism and surveillance, with chilling relevance to modern society.

name: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A tragic tale of love, wealth, and the American Dream set in the opulent Jazz Age, filled with vivid characters and beautiful prose.

name: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
review: A delightful romantic comedy that cleverly satirizes the societal norms of early 19th-century England, with memorable characters and witty dialogue.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
review: A poignant coming-of-age story that captures the disillusionment and alienation of adolescence, resonating with readers for generations.

name: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
review: A captivating fantasy adventure that introduces readers to the enchanting world of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, brimming with magic and imagination.
